comments:
I use MyEclipse to create a new Enterprise Application Project, naming it the following way:
ear-project: testrename.ear
web-project: testrename
ejb-project: testrename.jar

I create a package and some classes in the src-folder of the ejb-project:

testrename
   |
   *- TestRename.java
   |
   *- TestRenameManager.java

I put some code in each of the classes, making TestRenameManager refer to TestRename.

In package explorer, I select "TestRename.java" and press "Alt-Shift-R". The renaming dialog comes up and I type in "TestRenaming" as the new name, checking only the "Update references" checkbox. When I press "next" I get:

"An unexpected exception occurred. See the error log for more details
Class file name must end with .class"

I press "OK" (the only alternative) and get back to the dialog with:

"An unexpected exception occurred while creating a change object. See the error log for more details".

I press "cancel" (other alternative is "back"), and no renaming has occurred.

Attached at the bottom is the relevant part of the .log-file.

I tried creating another Enterprise Application project named like this:
ear-project: testrenaming
web-project: testrenamingWeb
ejb-project: testrenamingEJB

In this project the renaming works fine.

If relevant, here's my installed plugins for eclipse:

Eclipse Java Development Tools 3.2.1 performance patch (bug:159325) 1.0.0
Eclipse Platform 3.2.1 patch (bugs: 146869, 162935, 163106)
Eclipse Project SDK 3.2.1.r321_v20060801-tQ1w49KnTArT0FZ
Eclipse RCP 3.2.1 patch (bugs:161976, 162146, 162598) 1.0.0

Hibernate Tools 3.2.0.beta8
JBossRules Feature 3.0.4
org.jbpm.gd.jpdl.feature 3.0.12
P4WSAD 2005.2.3644
TestNG 5.4.0.0

MyEclipse Application Server Tooling 5.1.0
MyEclipse Base Platform Support 5.1.0

MyEclipse Web Services Support 5.1.0

Additionaly, there's a bug when you rename projects. I tried renaming "myproject.jar" (which is a MyEclipse EJB project) to "myprojectEJB". Everything went okay, except for renaming of dependent projects in other projects .project-files.

So i the project "myprojectWeb", the following content was still present in the .project file after the rename:

<projectDescription>
	<name>myprojectWeb</name>
	<comment></comment>
	<projects>
		<project>myproject.jar</project>
	</projects>
...

Should have been:
...
		<project>myprojectEJB</project>
...

Please file a new bug for the problem in comment 1. 
The first one looks like a problem in the search engine.

Not sure this is a search issue in this case but more like a classpath problem. It sounds like the testrename.jar file is seen as a class file instead of a library... Note that we do not have similar issue in Eclipse SDK 3.2.1.

Move to Web Tools product/EJB component to investigate further and confirm this assumption (they surely can know more than us about this kind of configuration...)
